title: Niagara County Human Resources Yearly Salaries

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Niagara County Human Resources Yearly Salaries
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

SENT VIA EMAIL TO peter.lopes@niagaracounty.com on 4/30/2024.

1.) Yearly salary, name, and title of any and all Niagara County Human Resource employees for the following timeframe: 01/01/2023 through 12/31/2023.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

The Riford Family

communications.subject: FOIL #194-24
communications.communication:
Good afternoon.  Please see attached in response to FOIL #194-24.

Thank you.


​Carla Flatau
Confidential Assistant to HR Director
716-438-4070 Phone
716-438-4077 Fax


Notice: This electronic transmission is intended for the sole use of the individual or entity to which it is addressed and may contain confidential, privileged or otherwise legally protected information. If you are not the intended recipient, or if you believe you are not the intended recipient, you are hereby notified that any use, disclosure, copying, distribution, or the taking of any action in reliance on the contents of this information, is strictly prohibited. Niagara County is not responsible for the content of any external hyperlink referenced in this email or any email. IF YOU HAVE RECEIVED THIS TRANSMISSION IN ERROR, PLEASE NOTIFY THE SENDER IMMEDIATELY BY EMAIL AND DELETE THE ORIGINAL MESSAGE ALONG WITH ANY PAPER OR ELECTRONIC COPIES. Thank you for your cooperation.

files.source: Niagara County Human Resources, Niagara County, NY

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: Emory University
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1) Any communications sent to or received from Emory University administration or staff on April 24, 25 or 26, 2024. 

2) Any communications sent to or received from the Emory University Police Department on April 24, 25, or 26, 2024. 

3) Any report concerning arrests or other interactions with demonstrators at or near Emory University on April 25, 2024.

Please also note that this request seeks public records wherever they may be found, including on personal cell phones or social media accounts used to conduct public business.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rebecca Burns

 Additional Information To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

1) Any communications sent to or received from Emory University administration or staff on April 24, 25 or 26, 2024. 

2) Any communications sent to or received from the Emory University Police Department on April 24, 25, or 26, 2024. 

3) Any report concerning arrests or other interactions with demonstrators at or near Emory University on April 25, 2024. 

Please also note that this request seeks public records wherever they may be found, including on personal cell phones or social media accounts used to conduct public business. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial
 purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Rebecca Burns

Please direct questions to the Open Records Office by calling (404) 546-7448 or by visiting www.atlantapd.org. Please be advised that pursuant to O.C.G.A. 50-18-71 a research fee not to exceed the hourly rate of the lowest paid, full time employee capable of researching the requested information may be associated with your request. In addition, there may be a cost of $0.10 per page for copies and $1.00 per disc or tape used for your request. Documents and materials will be emailed to the contact email address provided unless
 otherwise specified by the requestor. You will be contacted when your information is ready. 
 PLEASE DO NOT SUBMIT PRE-PAYMENT YOU WILL RECEIVE AN INVOICE 
 

Thank you, 
Atlanta Police Department

communications.subject: RE: Atlanta Police Open Records Request
communications.communication:
Hi, Rebecca,

We will work on getting you the reports, but we need more information in order to perform any communications search. Please provide emails, domain names, and key words.

Thanks.

communications.subject: RE: Georgia Open Records Act Request #46249
communications.communication:
Hi,

Thanks for your response and for working on the third item of my request. Regarding the first two items, please perform a search of the APD email server for communications sent to or received from any address with an "emory.edu" or "police.emory.edu" domain name from April 24 - 26, 2024.
